abstract: If a business is not expanding, chances are it is withering away. Here are some ideas that could keep your company thriving.
snippet: If a business is not expanding, chances are it is withering away. Here are some ideas that could keep your company thriving.
lead_paragraph: If you Google the phrase “grow or die,” you get more than 11 million hits. So clearly there is something to the idea that if a business is not expanding it is withering away.

headline.main: More Than One Way to Help a Business Grow

abstract: Salesforce.com wants to become a platform like Microsoft’s Windows operating system, a product so popular that it is the foundation for a veritable ecosystem of software developers.
snippet: Salesforce.com wants to become a platform like Microsoft’s Windows operating system, a product so popular that it is the foundation for a veritable ecosystem of software developers.
lead_paragraph: Marc Benioff has never been modest in his dreams for Salesforce.com, the business software company he founded in 1999.

abstract: European competition authorities refused to approve Google’s purchase of DoubleClick, and ordered an in-depth review amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.
snippet: European competition authorities refused to approve Google’s purchase of DoubleClick, and ordered an in-depth review amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.
lead_paragraph: PARIS, Nov. 13 — European Commission competition authorities refused today to approve Google’s $3.1 billion purchase of DoubleClick, the Internet advertising company, and ordered an in-depth review amid opposition from rivals, publishers and consumer groups.

headline.main: Google Hits European Hurdle on DoubleClick Deal

abstract: For Google, the future of social networks is not Orkut. For Yahoo, it’s not Yahoo Mash. Both are betting that e-mail and personal home pages can be extended to undercut the activity now on Facebook and MySpace.
snippet: For Google, the future of social networks is not Orkut. For Yahoo, it’s not Yahoo Mash. Both are betting that e-mail and personal home pages can be extended to undercut the activity now on Facebook and MySpace.
lead_paragraph: Ignore Orkut, OpenSocial, Yahoo Mash and Yahoo 360. Google and Yahoo have come up with new and very similar plans to respond to the challenge from MySpace and Facebook: They hope to turn their e-mail systems and personalized home page services (iGoogle and MyYahoo) into social networks.

headline.main: Inbox 2.0: Yahoo and Google to Turn E-Mail Into a Social Network
